turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Little Salt Spring.
turn.1: What is unique about the Little Salt Spring geology?
turn.2: The basin around the spring and a slough extending away from it are filled with moist, soft peat.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Hundreds of burials dating from 5,200 to 6,800 years ago have been found in the slough.
turn.6: As has happened in other wetland burials in Florida, such as at the Windover Archaeological Site, brain matter survived in many of the skulls.
turn.7: What else did you find interesting?
turn.8: In the 1970s the overturned shell of an extinct giant land tortoise was found on the ledge.
turn.10: A wooden stake had been driven between the carapace and the plastron, and there is evidence of a fire under the tortoise.
turn.12: It appears that the tortoise had been cooked in its shell.
